summary: This Virgin Islands Daily News article from May 26, 2023, covers two main topics: a test flight by American Airlines to the British Virgin Islands and, in a continuation from a previous page, details from a JPMorgan court filing regarding Jeffrey Epstein's activities and donations in the U.S. Virgin Islands. The article reports on allegations about Epstein's donations to the University of the Virgin Islands and visits by officials to his islands, while also including denials and clarifications from the university and officials.

persons.name: Dean Greenaway
persons.context: Author of the news article reporting on the American Airlines test flight and Epstein-related court filing details.

persons.name: Edward Singh
persons.context: Provided details about the American Airlines test flight operations and training at the BVI airport.

persons.name: Kye Rymer
persons.context: Commented on the significance of the American Airlines test flight for the territory.

persons.name: Ellsworth
persons.context: Authored the court filing cited in the article, making allegations about Epstein's activities and donations in the USVI.

persons.name: Tamika Thomas Williams
persons.context: Previously provided information to The Daily News about donations received from Epstein's organization, Enhanced Education.

persons.name: Hall
persons.context: Provided a statement denying the university received a specific $20,000 check from Epstein and having no knowledge of a 'bespoke' class for his victims.

persons.name: de Jongh
persons.context: Named in the JPMorgan filing as one of several officials who allegedly visited Epstein's islands 'with regularity'.

persons.name: Kenneth Mapp
persons.context: Named in the JPMorgan filing as one of several officials who allegedly visited Epstein's islands 'with regularity'.

persons.name: Dawn Henry
persons.role: Former Commissioner for the V.I. Department of Planning and Natural Resources
persons.context: Named in the JPMorgan filing; she previously denied personally visiting Epstein's islands and declined to comment citing an upcoming deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case. The article discusses allegations about his donations to UVI, construction on his islands, and visits from officials.

connections.description: Enhanced Education is identified as one of Epstein's organizations that made donations to the University of the Virgin Islands.
Epstein, through his company Enhanced Education, made several donations to UVI between 2003 and 2007, totaling $17,900 according to UVI records.
The JPMorgan filing alleges de Jongh visited Epstein's islands 'with regularity'.
The JPMorgan filing alleges former Governor Mapp visited Epstein's islands 'with regularity'.
As former DPNR Commissioner, Henry dealt with Epstein regarding illegal construction and environmental violations on his private islands.
Ellsworth is identified as the attorney authoring the court filing on behalf of JPMorgan.

events.title: American Airlines Test Flight to BVI
events.description: An Envoy-operated ERJ 175 aircraft conducted a test flight from Miami to Terrence B. Lettsome Airport in Tortola, BVI, to prepare for inaugural passenger flights.

events.title: Planned Inaugural American Airlines Flights to BVI
events.description: American Airlines is scheduled to land two planes directly from Miami to the British Virgin Islands for the first time.

events.title: JPMorgan Court Filing Released
events.description: JPMorgan submitted a court filing containing allegations about Jeffrey Epstein's activities in the USVI, including donations to UVI and visits by officials to his islands.

events.title: Epstein's Conviction
events.description: Mentioned as the year after which UVI decided to decline future gifts from Epstein.

events.title: Daily News Interview with Dawn Henry
events.description: The Virgin Islands Daily News published an interview with former DPNR Commissioner Dawn Henry about her dealings with Epstein and enforcement issues on his islands.

keyFacts: A JPMorgan court filing alleges the University of the Virgin Islands (UVI) structured a 'bespoke class' to enroll Epstein's victims and provide cover for their presence, the same year Epstein allegedly donated $20,000 through a company.
UVI President Hall stated the university found no record of receiving a $20,000 check from Epstein related to an ESL program and denied authorizing any course for individuals connected to Epstein.
UVI records show it received $17,900 total from Epstein's organization 'Enhanced Education' between 2003 and 2007, not a single $20,000 donation.

The JPMorgan filing alleges several USVI officials, including former Gov. Kenneth Mapp and former Commissioner Dawn Henry, visited Epstein's private islands 'with regularity'. Henry has previously denied personally setting foot on the islands.
The article reports on a separate, contemporaneous event: a successful test flight by American Airlines to the British Virgin Islands, ahead of planned inaugural passenger service.
